subtopics.title: Overview
subtopics.content: Cloudy Ltd. is a cloud technology consultancy that provides services across Australia and New Zealand. Established in 2018, the company has grown into a trusted partner for businesses looking to adopt cloud-native infrastructure, automate operations, and implement cost-effective solutions. The company’s key offerings include cloud architecture design, Infrastructure as Code (IaC) development, DevOps transformation, and FinOps advisory services. Cloudy Ltd. primarily works with organizations in the healthcare, education, and retail sectors.

subtopics.title: Purpose
subtopics.content: This report presents an in-depth analysis of Cloudy Ltd.’s current Azure infrastructure usage, with the goal of aligning their practices with the FinOps Foundation’s best practices. The assessment aims to uncover cost inefficiencies, validate governance and resource management practices, and provide actionable recommendations that can be implemented to achieve better financial outcomes in the cloud. Cloudy Ltd. is currently experiencing growth in both its customer base and infrastructure footprint. As a result, cloud costs have increased significantly over the past six months. This assessment is part of a broader initiative to improve cloud visibility and establish automated governance using both in-house and third-party tools.

subtopics.title: Methodology
subtopics.content: Data for this report was collected using an internal survey powered by Google Forms and integrated into a centralized Azure SQL database. Each response was evaluated using a maturity model aligned with FinOps standards, and technical recommendations were generated based on industry benchmarks and AI-assisted analysis.

subtopics.title: Summary of Findings
content: Cloudy Ltd.’s cloud maturity score is 3.8 out of 5, indicating an intermediate level of cloud maturity.
The organization has a total cloud spend of $547,890, with a potential savings opportunity of $309,450.
Key challenges include increasing infrastructure costs, low resource utilization, and insufficient cost allocation tracking.
Recommendations include implementing rightsizing for identified VMs, converting eligible workloads to reserved instances, and enhancing Infrastructure as Code practices.

subtopics.title: Key Recommendations
content: Implement rightsizing for 28 identified VMs to optimize resource allocation.
Convert eligible workloads to reserved instances to reduce costs.
Deploy automated scheduling for non-production resources to minimize waste.
Enhance Infrastructure as Code implementation to improve governance and automation.

subtopics.title: Expected Impact
subtopics.content: By adopting the recommendations provided in this report, Cloudy Ltd. is expected to reduce cloud spend by up to 25% over the next 12 months, improve governance and traceability of resources, and accelerate the path toward FinOps maturity. This sets a strong foundation for scaling infrastructure while maintaining control over financial operations.

subtopics.title: Understanding Cloud Maturity
subtopics.content: Cloud maturity refers to an organization's progression in adopting, managing, and optimizing cloud technologies. The model used in this report visualizes maturity across five stages: Initial, Foundation, Defined, Measured, and Optimized. As the organization advances through these stages, customer value and cloud effectiveness increase.

subtopics.title: Current Cloud Maturity Level
subtopics.content: Cloudy Ltd. achieved an overall cloud maturity score of 3.8 out of 5, placing the organization at an 'Intermediate' level. This suggests a strategic and growing adoption of cloud practices with optimization efforts underway. Compared to an industry average of 3.1, Cloudy Ltd. is ahead of the curve but still has room to improve, especially in Operational Excellence and Organizational Adaptability.

subtopics.title: Dimensional Analysis
subtopics.content: Each maturity dimension has been rated on a scale from 1 (low maturity) to 5 (high maturity). These scores highlight areas of strength and those requiring strategic investment. Security and Strategic Vision are relatively mature, while Operational Excellence and Adaptability need further development.

subtopics.title: Growth Trajectory & Recommendations
subtopics.content: To support Cloudy LTD’s evolution toward an optimized cloud state, we recommend the following actions:
shortTermFocus: Develop more comprehensive organizational cloud training
longTermObjectives: Build a more adaptive, technology-driven organizational culture

maturityLevels.description: There is awareness of cloud and some groups are beginning to implement cloud computing elements.
An approach has been decided upon and is applied opportunistically. Capability is recognized and in foundational stages of implementation.
Capability is defined consistently and systematically implemented across the organization. Efficiency gains are noticeable.
Velocity and quality of cloud capabilities are increasing. Capability is proactively managed and the results are consistently measurable across the organization.
Capability is optimized across the organization and continually improved upon through automation, enabling proactive market disruption.

subtopics.title: Current Expenditure Overview
subtopics.content: Cloudy LTD has experienced a steady increase in cloud usage over the last fiscal quarter. This growth is primarily driven by the expansion of container workloads in Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) and a rise in demand for analytics and storage services. This section provides an overview of how cloud resources are currently being utilized, alongside cost efficiency indicators.

specificRecommendations.title: Right-size over-provisioned VMs
specificRecommendations.description: Reduce resources allocated to 12 identified VMs running consistently under 30% utilization

specificRecommendations.title: Convert to reserved instances
specificRecommendations.description: Purchase 3-year reserved instances for 18 VMs with stable workloads

specificRecommendations.title: Implement automatic shutdown
specificRecommendations.description: Schedule automatic shutdown for development environments during non-business hours

specificRecommendations.title: Archive cold storage data
specificRecommendations.description: Move 34TB of infrequently accessed data to archive storage tier

specificRecommendations.title: Remove unused load balancers
specificRecommendations.description: Decommission 8 unused load balancers identified in the environment

recommendations: Standardize template structure across all development teams
Implement drift detection and automatic remediation
Add policy-as-code validation in CI/CD pipeline
